description: Spent four nights on the MS BlueShadow from Luxor to Aswan, stopping every day to view archeological sites such as The Valley of the Kings, Hatshetsup's Temple, the Temple of Horus, Edfu, Kom Ombo Temple and Philae Temple.  The ship is in very good condition.  Of all the other boats we saw during our cruise, the BlueShadow appeared the newest and in the best condition. The ship is clean and the staff are friendly and accommodating.    The cabins are well-furnished, modern, and spacious (larger than those found on mega cruise ships). Our room had a large window and flatscreen TV, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom had a shower/tub combo and there is ample closet space.   We traveled in July, with outside temps of 113 degrees Farenheit.  The boat is kept cool, almost too cool.  I recommend that you pack a sweatshirt or fleece for the common areas as the AC is blasting nearly non-stop. It made for a refreshing contrast when returning from the boat after several hours signtseeing in the intense Egyptian summer heat.  The food service is good for a boat of this size. All meal service is buffet style, and there is sufficient variety such that you should be able to find a food to your liking.  The daily Egyptian Dish specials were particularly good. Wait staff was attentive with clearing plates and serving beverages.  Water is not included, but a 1.5L bottle costs less than $2 US. We spent about $20 US total on water for the entire four-day cruise, which I thought was reasonable. The sun deck has ample space and a small pool to cool off in. We spent hours reclined under the canopy watching life unfold on the banks of the river.  It was very tranquil and provided a unique perspective on life in Egypt  outside Cairo.  This is THE way to see Egypt, both ancient and modern.  I recommend this trip and this cruise line to anyone who wishes to see all that Egypt has to offer.‚Ä¶
